page.title: 05WATER SUPPLY FROM SELSFIELD
page.content: The{water tower}at{Selsfield,}one of the highest places in the area, was built in the 1920s and has a capacity of 500 cubic metres (110,000 gallons). The covered{service reservoir}on {Selsfield Common}was built in 1972 and has a capacity of 2800 cubic metres (616,000 gallons). It is supplied with water by the {Mid-Sussex Water Company}from the {River Ouse}at{Barcombe Mills}via {Horsted Keynes}and{Grovelands,}or by the{Southern Water Authority}via the pumping station at{Turners Hill.}This water is then re-pumped to the Selsfield tower from the Selsfield Common reservoir to supply the higher areas and{West Hoathly.
